newsitem.title: UK: NWE gas oil spreads steady in slow discussion.
newsitem.headline: NWE gas oil spreads steady in slow discussion.

text.p: European gas oil differentials were steady on Monday in very thin volume, traders said.
September IPE futures slipped $1.75 a tonne to trade at $169.50. October was $1.50 down at $171.50.
A small barge of Rotterdam refinery heating oil changed hands at September IPE flat, but it was the only reported trade in a quiet start to the week.
Offers were consistently at 50 cents over the screen with bids 50 cents under. German demand was again very slow.
For September lifting heating oil was bid at 50 cents over the screen with offers at September $1.25 fob ARA.

Low sulphur diesel for storage in Rotterdam and refinery in Antwerp and Flushing was offered at around $4.50 over September. Rotterdam refinery was offered at a premium of around $5.50 and bid at a premium of around $4.
"It's extremely quiet all over," a cargo trader said.
French heating oil was offered at flat to the cif high quotation cif Le Havre.
Low sulphur diesel was bid at September +$4.50 for second half August delivery and offered at September +$5.75 for September delivery.
